article.headline: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock rises Wednesday, still underperforms market
article.body: Shares of Colgate-Palmolive Co. CL, +1.30% inched 0.76% higher to $78.13 Wednesday, on what proved to be an all-around favorable trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX, +0.87% rising 1.74% to 3,419.44 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% rising 1.91% to 28,303.46. Colgate-Palmolive Co. closed $1.97 short of its 52-week high ($80.09), which the company reached on September 3rd. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Wednesday, as Procter & Gamble Co. PG, +0.89% rose 0.78% to $140.70, Unilever PLC ADR UL, +1.44% rose 0.50% to $62.04, and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC RBGPF, +0.93% fell 0.42% to $95.20. Trading volume (1.9 M) remained 1.2 million below its 50-day average volume of 3.1 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
